intro: Humiria balsamifera var. guaiquinimana, commonly known as Guaiquinimana balsam. It is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Colombia and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, resinous leaves and small, clustered flowers. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Its unique chemical composition includes compounds used in traditional medicine and perfumery.
